name: Camellia Hue Hotel

reviews.title: EXTREMELY COURTEOUS AND WELL TRAINED STAFF
reviews.text: Our tour group of 13 people did enjoy our stay at the Camellia Hue Hotel because of their excellent staff. We had several of our group who were ill, and they were most helpful to them and provided excellent room service Extremely polite and well trained staff.

reviews.title: Camellia Hotel made our stay in Hue wonderful
reviews.text: Good breakfasts.

reviews.title: uperior service
reviews.text: We were not able to eat dinner in the dining room because of a private party, but the staff gave us excellent room service.

reviews.title: Good but Noisey
reviews.text: The Camellia staff was so attentive and helpful, and the rooms and breakfast so consistently good, that we would definitely return there if we went back to Hue. The hotel is located on a busy side street within walking distance of the restaurant district, and we were able to easily walk to dinner or lunch each day. The Citadel is about a 20 minute walk through interesting areas. Food at breakfast was great, and offered lots of choice. But the best thing of all was the staff. Everyone was friendly and very helpful, to the degree that one manager walked my husband down the street, stopping at many stores to try and find a box that we could pack some large lanterns in, for transport on the plane.

reviews.title: Fantastic smaller hotel - great value
reviews.text: While I had some bad weather in Hue. I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff were incredible and could be the model for servuce anywhere. Breakfast could have been better. I did not hear any noise myslef and the roomn was the best I had in Vietnamr

reviews.title: Not quite 4 star, but great service
reviews.text: We enjoyed a stay here for 3 nights during our visit to SE Asia. We were welcomed with a glass of refreshments upon arrival, and the very helpful ladies at the reception desk swiftly checked us in and showed us to our room.

reviews.title: Great value - right in the heart fo the city
reviews.text: This is billed as a 4 star hotel, but the room wasn't in a great condition, and the whole place really could do with a refurbishment. Also there's a club on the 10th floor which does generate rather a lot of noise for the floors near to it. The breakfast wasn't much to write home about as well, being a buffet with the same choices every day, none of which very inspired. And finally, the advertised "pool" and "fully fitted gym" were really a joke, the pool being more like an oversized bath but and the "gym" consisting of 2 machines next to it..

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: All this was more than compensated for by the excellent service, as everywhere in Vietnam the staff was extremely helpful, and went out of their way to resolve any of our issues. Also the hotel has a very good, and cheap, in-house tour desk, where they sorted us out with some excellent tours, and drivers.

reviews.title: A chic hotel convenient to the old city.
reviews.text: The hotel rates are also pretty good for the location, level of service and space you get, and the views of the city from the higher floors is really quite inspiring, especially at night.

reviews.title: Fantastic rooms, service and value!
reviews.text: The Cameilia is conveniently located right near both the historic quarter of Hue and tye city's business district. You can easily walk just about anywhere. The rooms are spacious with upgraded bathrooms (andthankfully a hairdryer) and the A/C works great. The breakfast is a dream - just about anything you could want (including yummy chocolate croissants) is up there. I also booked a massage at the spa in the basement (1 our for $13 USD) - came in handy after a long day of sightseeing. The pool is small, but nice and clean - totally refreshing after the heat of central Vietnam. The primary site to see - the Citadel - is either a cab, boat or bus ride away - as you have to cross the river. Be careful fo pick pockets and overzealous salespeople down by the river - they can be relentless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in June and loved the hotel. The breakfast buffet was delicious and had great views of Hue. The internet staff was really helpful, we had a lot of issues getting online but the staff quickly came to our service and helped us out with connection issues. Rooms were nice sized. It got busy in the evenings with the nightclub and trying to use the elevators. Overall, great hotel and comfortable staying here.
reviews.title: Great hotel, friendly staff

reviews.text: The Camellia hue is a stunning hotel. We arrived to a wonderful receptionist who was really chatty and funny and she got our stay off to a relaxed and friendly start.
reviews.title: Helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 7th floor and the view was great.
reviews.title: Not much personality- an OK Hotel- lots of large travel groups

reviews.text: The rooms are large, modern but warm, with excellent amenities! Toiletries are much better than your standard hotel bar of soap….
reviews.title: great for everything !

reviews.text: I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: love this gem
Great Hotel, Hard to Beat in Hue
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in a deluxe city view room. The room was very spacious, clean an tidy and well presented. The hotel has modern furnishings and is kept in good condition.

reviews.title: Nice staff and clean
reviews.text: The rooms were thoroughly cleaned and re-stocked after every night. Internet, Cable TV, the usual tea, coffee and ironing board were all functional and clean. Air Conditioning was also in good working order. The bathroom provisions were plentiful and the the bath/shower were also well presented. The shower had good pressure and there were no problems with lack of warm water.

reviews.title: Loved the Hotel
reviews.text: A buffet breakfast was provided each morning on the top floor. There was a good selection of Vietnamese and Western bites from which to choose. The hotel room service did have a good selection but was x4 the price for the same meal from one to the many street cafes in the area.

reviews.title: Just as a 4* should be
reviews.text: All the hotels we saw in Hue are on the south side of the river. The main attraction of Hue, the citadel, with it's magnificent temples, shrines and imperial buildings, is located a 25 minute walk away. A healthy pair of legs and a good attitude will be enough to walk the tour from the hotel, around the Citadel and back. Give yourself a minimum 3-4 hours. There are many motorbikes and cyclos eager to provide you with a lift if you require and the hotel does provide tours with a guide if required. Be prepared to pay over and above for this service.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is a 10 minute taxi journey (USD2 pp) from the train station. The hotel were also able to book our taxi to Hoi An for USD70, a 4 hour journey via the pass that stops at 3 places of our choosing. This is expensive compared to other offerings so shop around and ensure you know what you are getting for your money.

description: The Camellia Hue Hotel has an ideal location in the heart of Hue city, just steps away from the Perfume river on a street with several tourist information spots. The Camellia Hue Hotel with its 'Beyond Expectations' services welcome you to Charmed Hue.
